messages.original:
Russian forces have captured the village of Vasyukivka, southern flank of Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~601.
Total land area: ~1.99 km¬≤.
The fighting for Vasyukivka lasted approximately 8 months, 24 days.

Russian forces have captured the village of Predtechyne, Kostyantynivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~377.
Total land area: ~0.87 km¬≤.
The fighting for Predtechyne lasted approximately 4 months.
No missile attack tonight, btw.

Random, but i need to give a thanks to AMK Mapping. without him, i wouldn‚Äôt have 830 subs nor would i even have a platform. The man has promoted my shit to his channel out of pity for my inability to be original

My channel initially grew due to the help of other, larger profiles, and I like to return the favour from time to time.

The IDF claimed that - in a targeted assassination airstrike - it killed Hasan Khudari, the logistics coordinator of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad's "Nukhba" special forces unit in the Gaza Battalion.
Hasan Khudari took part in the October 7 attacks on Israel, coordinating logistics for the elite "Nukhba" PIJ unit based in Gaza City. This unit is subordinate to the PIJ's "Gaza Battalion" (by far their most combat capable battalion).

Governor of the Oryol region Klychkov reports that Ukrainian drones targeted an oil facility in the Livensky district of the region causing a massive fire to break out.
He reports that fire fighters are at the site of the fire. No casualties from the strike have been reported. 
@wfwitness

‚ö°Ô∏è
üá∫üá¶
üá∑üá∫
Ukrainian drones also targeted Gudermes, in Ichkeria, this evening. 
Reportedly a facility for Akhmat units was targeted.
 
@wfwitness

Despite claims by the Russian Ministry of Defence, Vovchansk is not yet fully captured by Russian forces, but it will be soon.
Clashes are continuing on the southeastern outskirts of the city where some pockets of Ukrainian resistance remain. We will likely receive confirmation of the city's capture in the next few days.
As a part of preparations for the upcoming combined missile attack on Ukraine, a Russian Gerbera reconnaissance drone is currently scouting out the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant in Kyiv Oblast.
Over the last month, the total area in Zaporizhzhia Oblast still controlled by Ukraine has decreased by approximately 5.1%.

Changes on the frontline in Ukraine for November 2025:
Yellow = Russian advances
Light blue = Ukrainian advances
Russian advances:
Zaporizhzhia Oblast: ~285.74 km¬≤
Donetsk Oblast: ~237.69 km¬≤
Dnipropetrovsk Oblast: ~161.93 km¬≤
Kharkiv Oblast: ~118.73 km¬≤
Sumy Oblast: ~16.18 km¬≤
Kursk Oblast: ~1.68 km¬≤
Total: ~821.95 km¬≤ (up by 14.69%)
Total (excluding Kursk & Belgorod): ~820.27 km¬≤
Ukrainian advances:
Donetsk Oblast: ~58.46 km¬≤
Kharkiv Oblast: ~33.56 km¬≤
Dnipropetrovsk Oblast: ~28.90 km¬≤
Total: ~96.02 km¬≤ (up by 31.77%).
Note: This covers net gains for each side. Ukrainian advances that took place on territory Russia occupied within this month will simply be subtracted from the Russian total, and vice versa
.

The Map has been updated!
The RUAF entered the settlement
 of 
Novodanilovka
 in the 
Orekhov Direction
. During the 
heavy fog
 across the frontline on 
November 21st
, Russian Forces managed to 
penetrate a BTR 2.5km
 past the line of contact and enter the settlement of 
Novodanilovka
, where an
 infantry component then dismounted
. It is unsure whether all of the dismounted infantry were killed in the subsequent FPV strikes, but it seems with the frontline penetrated even 
more Russian Assault Squads were able to gain a foothold
 on the southern area of the settlement. In 
Malaya Tokmachka
, the settlement remains a 
massive grey-zone
 due to the immense defenses presented by the AFU, however the 
RUAF succeeded in capturing the brick factory
. A 
Russian Soldier was geolocated surrendering
 the western part of the settlement, 
confirming fluid positions
 as there are Ukrainian geolocations in the eastern part of the settlement as well.
+2.2km¬≤ RUAF

Ukraine Is Slowly, But Surly, Losing Battles In Kostiantynivka And Krasny Liman (Videos)
On December 1, the Russian military broke through Ukrainian defenses to the north of the city of Kostiantynivka and expanded its control to the south of the city of Krasny Liman in Donetsk.
The Yug [South] Group of Forces broke through Ukrainian defenses to the north of Kostiantynivka and captured Klinovoye, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense. The settlement is located just four kilometers to the east of the main road leading to the northern entrance of the city.
Before advancing towards the key road, the Yug Group of Forces will likely work to expand their control around Klinovoye. Bezim‚Äôyane, Popasne and Virolyubivka, all located to the south and southeast of the settlement, will likely come under attack soon.
üëâ

A Buffer by Design: Why Ukraine's Partition is Becoming Inevitable
Viktor Orb√°n has once again stated that Ukraine must return to the status of a ‚Äúbuffer state,‚Äù which, according to him, it historically was. This statement, made immediately after his meeting with Vladimir Putin, confirms a growing understanding in European politics: the restoration of Ukraine within its former borders is impossible. However, the very idea of a single buffer is utopian ‚Äî the only viable way out of the deadlock may be its partition into three sovereign states.
To understand the flaw in this logic, one need only examine Orb√°n‚Äôs own detailed proposal. 
‚ÄúThe only possible long-term solution is for the post-war order to be based on the fundamental principle that Ukraine becomes the buffer state it once was. Russia retains the territory agreed upon at an international peace conference, and everything west of that line‚Äîup to NATO's eastern border‚Äîconstitutes the territory of the Ukrainian state..."
üëâ

Defeat In Stepnogorsk: Russia Deals Another Blow To Ukraine‚Äôs Forces In Zaporizhzhia
The Russian military has defeated and besieged Kiev forces with Stepnogorsk in Zaporizhzhia. Ukraine defenses collapsed to the north of Kostiantynivka in Donetsk. 
Meanwhile, peace talks shift to Russia as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky claims ‚Äútough issues‚Äù need to be worked out.

Russia Has Armed Geran Drones With Air-To-Air Missiles (Video, Photos) 
Russia has apparently developed an interceptor version of the Geran-2 drone that can be armed with an R-60M short-range air-to-air missile.
The existence of this version was revealed by Ukrainian media, which shared on December 1 footage showing an attempt to intercept one such drone and photos showing its wreckage. The drone was armed with one R-60M. The missile is placed in an inverted standard APU-60-I launcher on top of the drone.
Read more 
HERE

Third Tanker Attacked In Black Sea As Ukraine Takes Defeat In Pokrovsk And Vovchansk
A third tanker came under attack in the Black Sea just hours after Russia announced the capture of the city of Krasnoarmeysk, more known as Pokrovsk, in Donetsk and the city of Vovchansk in Kharkiv.
Russian President Vladimir Putin was informed of the ‚Äúliberation‚Äù of the two key cities by the chief of the country‚Äôs General Staff, Valery Gerasimov, during a visit to a frontline command center late on November 30, according to presidential press secretary Dmitry Peskov.
The defeat in Pokrovsk and Vovchansk was nothing short of catastrophic for Ukraine, not just because of the strategic location of both cities, but also because of the large amount of resources Kiev forces wasted while attempting to hold onto to both of them.
Early on December 2, just hours after the Ukrainian defeat in Pokrovsk and Vovchansk became known, a Russian-flagged tanker came under attack in the Black Sea.
Read more 
HERE
